channel.title: Can't load multiple clients
channel.description:
I was fiddling around with rs, pretty basic, I wanted to load multiple clients, however, the first client loads fine, but when I try to load a second I get this:
Error: un.a client.init com.freddy.bot.loader.BotLoader.loadBot:17 com.freddy.bot.gui.BotGUI.addBot:32 com.freddy.bot.gui.BotGUI.actionPerformed:63 javax.swing.AbstractButton.fireActionPerformed javax.swing.AbstractButton$Handler.actionPerformed javax.swing.DefaultButtonModel.fireActionPerformed javax.swing.DefaultButtonModel.setPressed javax.swing.AbstractButton.doClick javax.swing.plaf.basic.BasicMenuItemUI.doClick javax.swing.plaf.basic.BasicMenuItemUI$Handler.mouseReleased java.awt.Component.processMouseEvent javax.swing.JComponent.processMouseEvent java.awt.Component.processEvent java.awt.Container.processEvent java.awt.Component.dispatchEventImpl java.awt.Container.dispatchEventImpl java.awt.Component.dispatchEvent java.awt.LightweightDispatcher.retargetMouseEvent java.awt.LightweightDispatcher.processMouseEvent java.awt.LightweightDispatcher.dispatchEvent java.awt.Container.dispatchEventImpl java.awt.Component.dispatchEvent java.awt.EventQueue.dispatchEvent java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpOneEventForFilters java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEventsForFilter java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEventsForHierarchy java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEvents java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEvents java.awt.EventDispatchThread.run | java.lang.NullPointerException error_game_crash
The cause seems to be that getAppletContext in my stub returns null, but i don't get why the first client works and the second doesn't... Any ideas? Basically i just load the applet, shove it into a panel and add that to a JTabbedPane control...

item.title: Can't load multiple clients
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

[quote=“Tenen, post:10, topic:325594”][quote author=Freddy1990 link=topic=421908.msg3097656#msg3097656 date=1263481852]
com.freddy.bot.loader.BotLoader.loadBot
[/quote]
it’s a trap![/quote]
ruler’s seal of approval

item.title: Can't load multiple clients
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

uhh if multiple clients run in the same context then they will obviously run into issues with static fields etc

Read full topic

item.title: Can't load multiple clients
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

It’s indeed in that applet subclass that the error occurred. I don’t quite get why though, even though it used the same classloader, the classes were only loaded once for the first client as it doesn’t load duplicate classes… Shouldn’t be a problem, of coruse, my knowledge of how java works internally only goes so far…

Read full topic

item.title: Can't load multiple clients
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:5, topic:325594”]static variables you retarded idiet[/quote]i understand that faggot, but as you can see if this method has been called < 3 times it should attempt to access the appletcontext:

Class238.anInt3372++; if(Class238.anInt3372 >= 3) { error(1, "alreadyloaded"); return; } else { getAppletContext().showDocument(getDocumentBase(), "_self"); return; } }so my question is why it wouldnt throw the exception with the first client,

i dont actually care enough to further debug, so i will leave it at that

Read full topic

item.title: Can't load multiple clients

item.description:

static variables you retarded idiet

Read full topic

item.title: Can't load multiple clients
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“Freddy1990, post:3, topic:325594”]Thanks, I solved the problem by giving each client it’s own classloader instance. Pretty stupid, lol[/quote]wow…

anyways do you mind debugging to see where the exception was thrown, just out of curiosity? it was most likely thrown in the last method i showed you, but im curious as to when that method is called

edit: hm that method is called in init(), im curious as to why it only threw an exception after the second instance of the client was loaded

Read full topic

item.title: Can't load multiple clients
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

Thanks, I solved the problem by giving each client it’s own classloader instance. Pretty stupid, lol

Read full topic

item.title: Can't load multiple clients
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

since it is not printing ‘error_game_’ before throwing the exception, i can assume it is not attempting to show an error page. the other instances the client accesses the appletcontext is in a certain generic method that handles url-requests/document-redirection and in another case where it accesses a document through its absolute url.

edit: here they are

static final Class19 method1254(Class142 class142, int i, String s, int j) { anInt5569++; if(i == 0) return class142.method1884(s, (byte)127); if(j >= -124) method1258('\uFF9A', 66); if(i == 1) { Class19 class19_1; try { Class173.method2127("openjs", class142.anApplet1712, 7182, new Object[] { (new URL(class142.anApplet1712.getCodeBase(), s)).toString() }); Class19 class19 = new Class19(); class19.anInt277 = 1; return class19; } catch(Throwable _ex) { class19_1 = new Class19(); } class19_1.anInt277 = 2; return class19_1; } if(i == 2) { Class19 class19_3; try { class142.anApplet1712.getAppletContext().showDocument(new URL(class142.anApplet1712.getCodeBase(), s), "_blank"); Class19 class19_2 = new Class19(); class19_2.anInt277 = 1; return class19_2; } catch(Exception _ex) { class19_3 = new Class19(); } class19_3.anInt277 = 2; return class19_3; } if(i == 3) { try { Class173.method2125(class142.anApplet1712, "loggedout", (byte)-121); } catch(Throwable _ex) { } Class19 class19_5; try { class142.anApplet1712.getAppletContext().showDocument(new URL(class142.anApplet1712.getCodeBase(), s), "_top"); Class19 class19_4 = new Class19(); class19_4.anInt277 = 1; return class19_4; } catch(Exception _ex) { class19_5 = new Class19(); } class19_5.anInt277 = 2; return class19_5; } else { throw new IllegalArgumentException(); } }

static final boolean method2707(int i, byte byte0) { anInt3395++; Class115_Sub1 class115_sub1 = Node.method102(i, (byte)-62); if(class115_sub1 == null) return false; if(Class142.anInt1714 != 3) { Class73.anInt953 = class115_sub1.anInt4803; Class143.aString1733 = class115_sub1.aString4808; if(Class45_Sub1_Sub1.aClass114_6580 != Class120.aClass114_1464) { Class6.anInt134 = Class73.anInt953 + 40000; Class3_Sub36_Sub16_Sub2.anInt6865 = Class73.anInt953 + 50000; Class49.anInt628 = Class6.anInt134; } return true; } String s = ""; if(Class45_Sub1_Sub1.aClass114_6580 != Class120.aClass114_1464) s = ":" + (7000 + class115_sub1.anInt4803); String s1 = ""; if(Class43.aString583 != null) s1 = "/p=" + Class43.aString583; if(byte0 != -31) method2709(-87); String s2 = "http://" + class115_sub1.aString4808 + s + "/l=" + Class188.anInt2628 + "/a=" + Class104.anInt1316 + s1 + "/j" + (Class176.aBoolean2357 ? "1" : "0") + ",o" + (Class153.aBoolean2048 ? "1" : "0") + ",a2"; try { Class88.aClient1113.getAppletContext().showDocument(new URL(s2), "_self"); } catch(Exception _ex) { return false; } return true; } it may help you debug

edit2: scratch what i said, i believe it is this method, in their applet subclass, that is troubling you:

[code] final void method53(int i, int j, int k, int l, int i1)
{
anInt17++;
try
{
if(l < 58)
windowClosed(null);
if(Class161.anApplet_Sub1_2158 != null)
{
Class238.anInt3372++;
if(Class238.anInt3372 >= 3)
{
error(1, “alreadyloaded”);
return;
} else
{
getAppletContext().showDocument(getDocumentBase(), “_self”);
return;
}
}
Class110.anInt1370 = Class3_Sub18_Sub19.anInt5917 = i1;
Class178.anInt2399 = j;
Class48.anInt626 = 0;
Class161.anApplet_Sub1_2158 = this;
Class38.anInt3657 = 0;
Class86.anInt3638 = Class159.anInt2139 = i;
if(Class3_Sub36_Sub15.aClass142_6521 == null)
Class251.aClass142_3593 = Class3_Sub36_Sub15.aClass142_6521 = new Class142(this, k, null, 0);
for(Class19 class19 = Class3_Sub36_Sub15.aClass142_6521.method1892(1, 7000, this); class19.anInt277 == 0;)
Class211_Sub4.method2447(-28114, 10L);

        return;
    }
    catch(Exception exception)

        Class168.method2087(exception, null, -30116);

}[/code]

item.title: Can't load multiple clients
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

I was fiddling around with rs, pretty basic, I wanted to load multiple clients, however, the first client loads fine, but when I try to load a second I get this:

Error: un.a client.init com.freddy.bot.loader.BotLoader.loadBot:17 com.freddy.bot.gui.BotGUI.addBot:32 com.freddy.bot.gui.BotGUI.actionPerformed:63 javax.swing.AbstractButton.fireActionPerformed javax.swing.AbstractButton$Handler.actionPerformed javax.swing.DefaultButtonModel.fireActionPerformed javax.swing.DefaultButtonModel.setPressed javax.swing.AbstractButton.doClick javax.swing.plaf.basic.BasicMenuItemUI.doClick javax.swing.plaf.basic.BasicMenuItemUI$Handler.mouseReleased java.awt.Component.processMouseEvent javax.swing.JComponent.processMouseEvent java.awt.Component.processEvent java.awt.Container.processEvent java.awt.Component.dispatchEventImpl java.awt.Container.dispatchEventImpl java.awt.Component.dispatchEvent java.awt.LightweightDispatcher.retargetMouseEvent java.awt.LightweightDispatcher.processMouseEvent java.awt.LightweightDispatcher.dispatchEvent java.awt.Container.dispatchEventImpl java.awt.Component.dispatchEvent java.awt.EventQueue.dispatchEvent java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpOneEventForFilters java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEventsForFilter java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEventsForHierarchy java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEvents java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEvents java.awt.EventDispatchThread.run | java.lang.NullPointerException
